com.github.mryf323.tractatus

Annotation Type UniqueTruePoint


  • @Target(value=METHOD)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Repeatable(value=UniqueTruePointContainer.class)
public @interface UniqueTruePoint
    Methods being annotated with this annotation, satisfy a unique true point test requirement (TR). This annotation indicates the original predicate, using element predicate, DNF form of that predicate using dnf element, the implicant being inspected using implicant element. Valuations of every clause used in the predicate, are also given using valuations element.

    Example below shows a sample usage of this annotation. 

         @UniqueTruePoint(
      predicate = "ab + cd",
      dnf = "ab + cd",
      implicant = "ab",
      valuations = {
          @Valuation(clause = 'a', valuation = true),
          @Valuation(clause = 'b', valuation = true),
          @Valuation(clause = 'c', valuation = false),
          @Valuation(clause = 'd', valuation = false)
      }
     )
     @Test
     public void test1() {
         ...
     }
    In the above example the predicate is already in DNF form, so dnf element and predicate values are the same. If the predicate was something like "a (b + c)", the value of element predicate would be "a (b + c)", were as the value of dnf element would be "ab + ac".

    Note: If a test method covers multiple unique true point TR s, you can annotate that method with UniqueTruePoint multiple times.

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      java.lang.String dnf 
      java.lang.String implicant 
      java.lang.String predicate
      String representation of a predicate.(i.e "a (b + c)")
      Valuation[] valuations
      Valuation of each clause.

    • Element Detail

      • predicate

        public abstract java.lang.String predicate
        String representation of a predicate.(i.e "a (b + c)")
        Returns:
        a string consists of '+' and some alphabetical clauses.

      • dnf

        public abstract java.lang.String dnf
        Returns:
        DNF form of the predicate

      • implicant

        public abstract java.lang.String implicant
        Returns:
        the implicant being inspected

      • valuations

        public abstract Valuation[] valuations
        Valuation of each clause.
        Returns:
        an array which assigns every clause in the predicate a value.
